chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Blake Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-No contact with victim: MaryJane Mongan, Nichole Otto
-Extended supervision may be transferred to Kansas or Missouri.
-Pay supervision fees.

Restitution due during term of extended supervision. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Notice of Hearing-Plea/sentencing hearing: Ryan Blake Berry
Sentencing hearing on November 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

State appears by Attorney Jeffrey Sisley. Defendant appears in court, in custody with Attorney Gerald Boyle. Plea questionnaire filed. Court advises defendant of penalties. State requesting PSI. Recommendation not put on record. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty on counts 1 and 2. Court orders a PSI. Matter adjourned for sentencing on 11-12-14 at 3:00 pm.
